Bag O' Links - 7/10/2009

08 Oct 2009

  • Pure CSS minimum margin – Have a minimum margin, even on IE.
  • Awesome list of Ruby libraries #1 – i just love those uber-collections, hiding away from civilization.
  • Seattle.rb awesome list of gems and plugins – these guys are well organized, we should do something like that in Miami.
  • jQote – javascript templates – a jQuery library to easily handle javascript template and avoid DOM hell.
  • 1000 free icons – fatcow guys are awesome, neat list of icons there.
  • Ruby 1.9.x server booklet – mongrel, passenger and more.
  • Recurring Payments with ActiveMerchant – a new and updated tutorial on that one.
  • Chargify – recurring payments in another way. looks neat.
  • identengine – a javascript library that retrieves and aggregates social profiles from around the web. nice.
  • Shoulda form rendering macro – check that a form was rendered with the right details.
  • RailsBridge BugMash VM – a cool project undergoing in purpose of making it easier to contribute to rails. awesome!
  • jQuery gadget plugin – easily create a javascript-html-ajax-css-magic bundle and distribute as a widget.
  • Ruby angels and daemons – Ruby / Rails background tasks made simple.
  • Advanced SearchLogic usage – some neat implementation that harnesses SearchLogic almost seamlessly, awesome.
  • iPhone on Rails – a library that simplifies the integration of iPhone applications and a Rails backend.
  • jQuery XML to JSON conversion – easy, simple, useful.
  • Ruby Queuing overview – AMQP, RabbitMQ – RabbitMQ is appealing, really.

GitHub Treasures

  • sanbit_translations – a rails plugin that gives adds a facebook like translation system to your rails app.
  • block_helpers – Block helpers for Rails views, similar to form builders but for general case.
  • metry_visitor – a middleware that tracks visitors to your website via cookies.
  • fear-of-callbacks – Activate logging of all your used ActiveRecord callback hooks.
  • inline-attachment – Makes image_tag in an ActionMailer template embed the images in the emails.
  • soa_registery – A Rails app for keeping track of APIs in your company.
